summary: This is a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team requesting court authorization to subpoena documents from the Epstein Victim's Compensation Program. The motion argues that the four accusers in the indictment received millions from the fund, and their compensation claims and related documents are critical for impeachment at trial to show potential bias and motive for fabrication.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, charged with conspiracy and sex trafficking related to Jeffrey Epstein. Her defense team is filing this motion to subpoena victim compensation records.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, signed the motion and is listed as counsel from HADDON, MORGAN & FOREMAN P.C.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as counsel from HADDON, MORGAN & FOREMAN P.C.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as counsel from COHEN & GRESSER LLP.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as counsel from Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the co-conspirator with Maxwell. The motion mentions his estate, the victim compensation fund named after him, and that some accusers had previously sued him.

connections.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell conspired with Epstein to recruit, entice, and transport minors for illegal sexual activity.
Pagliuca is one of the defense attorneys representing Maxwell, as indicated by his signature on the motion.
Menninger is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell on the motion.
Everdell is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell on the motion.
Stemheim is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell on the motion.

events.title: Government Begins 3500 Material Production
events.description: The government began producing discovery materials (3500 material) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, which included information about accusers receiving compensation.

events.title: Court Conference on Witness Designation
events.description: A court conference was held where the court ruled on referring to one individual as 'Witness-3' instead of 'Accuser-3'.

events.title: Filing of Motion for Subpoena
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed this motion seeking authorization to subpoena the Epstein Victim's Compensation Program.

events.title: Indictment Against Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in June 2019. The motion notes this indictment did not include the allegations of the four accusers in Maxwell's S2 indictment.

locations: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK
U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense sought to subpoena the Epstein Victim's Compensation Program for documents related to four accusers (referred to as Accuser-1, Accuser-2, Accuser-4, and Witness-3) who received millions in compensation.
The motion reveals specific settlement amounts: Accuser-1 received $5,000,000, Accuser-2 received $1,500,000, Witness-3 received $3,250,000, and Accuser-4 received $3,500,000 from the fund.
The defense argues the compensation creates a financial motive for the accusers to testify, making the claim forms and related documents critical for impeachment to show bias.
The motion states that lawyers for Accuser-2 and Witness-3 were instrumental in creating the terms of the Victim Compensation Program's Protocol.
The defense claims the Protocol rewards accusers if prosecutions against Epstein's employees (like Maxwell) move forward, suggesting the accusers had a financial interest in Maxwell's conviction.
